host.description: The host that the frontend should be bound to. Only used for local development.

port.description: The port that the frontend should be bound to. Only used for local development.

https.description: Only used for local development. The https object is passed to webpack in order to enable using https on localhost.

certificate.description: Parent object containing certificate and the private key

key.description: Https Certificate private key. Use $file to load in a file

cert.description: Https Certificate. Use $file to load in a file

baseUrl.description: The public absolute root URL that the frontend.

title.description: The title of the app, as shown in the Backstage web interface.

support.description: Information about support of this Backstage instance and how to contact the integrator team.

items.description: A list of categorized support item groupings.

title.description: The title of the support item grouping.

icon.description: An optional icon for the support item grouping.

links.description: A list of support links for the Backstage instance inside this grouping.

baseUrl.description: The public absolute root URL that the backend is reachable at, from the browser's perspective.

organization.description: Configuration that provides information about the organization that the app is for.

name.description: The name of the organization that the app belongs to.

homepage.description: This config was used by the HomepageTimer but has been replaced  by the HeaderWorldClock in the home plugin
homepage.deprecated: in favor of the HeaderWorldClock which is found in the home plugin

auth.description: Configuration that provides information on available configured authentication providers.

environment.description:
The 'environment' attribute added as an optional parameter to have configurable environment value for `auth.providers`.
default value: 'development'
optional values: 'development' | 'production'

enableExperimentalRedirectFlow.description: Enable redirect authentication flow type, instead of a popup for authentication.

endpoints.description:
Endpoints

A list of target baseUrls and the associated plugins.

target.description:
The target baseUrl to use for the plugin

Can be either a string or an object with internal and external keys. (Internal is used for the backend, external for the frontend)
Targets with `{{pluginId}}` or `{{ pluginId }} in the url will be replaced with the pluginId.

plugins.description: Array of plugins which use the target baseUrl.

catalog.description: Configuration options for the catalog plugin.

import.description: List of import flow specific options and attributes

entityFilename.description: Catalog entity descriptor filename, defaults to "catalog-info.yaml"

pullRequestBranchName.description:
A branch name used in pull request when registering existing component via UI
Valid git refname required, see: https://git-scm.com/docs/git-check-ref-format
Defaults to "backstage-integration"

techdocs.description: Configuration options for the techdocs plugin

builder.description: Documentation building process depends on the builder attr

legacyUseCaseSensitiveTripletPaths.description: Allows fallback to case-sensitive triplets in case of migration issues.

allowedIframeHosts.description:
Allows iframe tag only for listed hosts
Example:
 allowedIframeHosts: ["example.com"]
 this will allow all iframes with the host `example.com` in the src attribute

integrations.description: Configuration for integrations towards various external repository provider systems

host.description: The hostname of the given Azure instance
The hostname of the given Bitbucket instance

apiBaseUrl.description: The base url for the Bitbucket API, for example https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0

username.description: The username to use for authenticated requests.

appPassword.description: Bitbucket app password used to authenticate requests.

username.description: The username to use for authenticated requests.

appPassword.description: Bitbucket Cloud app password used to authenticate requests.

host.description: The hostname of the given Bitbucket Server instance

username.description: Username used to authenticate requests with Basic Auth.

password.description: Password (or token as password) used to authenticate requests with Basic Auth.

apiBaseUrl.description: The base url for the Bitbucket Server API, for example https://<host>/rest/api/1.0

host.description: The hostname of the given Gerrit instance

baseUrl.description: The base url for the Gerrit instance.

cloneUrl.description: The base url for cloning repos.

username.description: The username to use for authenticated requests.

password.description:
Gerrit password used to authenticate requests. This can be either a password
or a generated access token.

host.description: The hostname of the given GitHub instance

apiBaseUrl.description: The base url for the GitHub API, for example https://api.github.com

rawBaseUrl.description: The base url for GitHub raw resources, for example https://raw.githubusercontent.com

appId.description: The numeric GitHub App ID, string for environment variables

privateKey.description: The private key to use for auth against the app

allowedInstallationOwners.description:
List of installation owners allowed to be used by this GitHub app. The GitHub UI does not provide a way to list the installations.
However you can list the installations with the GitHub API. You can find the list of installations here:
https://api.github.com/app/installations
The relevant documentation for this is here.
https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/apps#list-installations-for-the-authenticated-app--code-samples

host.description: The host of the target that this matches on, e.g. "gitlab.com".

apiBaseUrl.description:
The base URL of the API of this provider, e.g.
"https://gitlab.com/api/v4", with no trailing slash.

May be omitted specifically for public GitLab; then it will be deduced.

token.description:
The authorization token to use for requests to this provider.

If no token is specified, anonymous access is used.

baseUrl.description:
The baseUrl of this provider, e.g. "https://gitlab.com", which is
passed into the GitLab client.

If no baseUrl is provided, it will default to https://${host}.

googleGcs.description: Integration configuration for Google Cloud Storage

clientEmail.description: Service account email used to authenticate requests.

privateKey.description: Service account private key used to authenticate requests.

awsS3.description: Integration configuration for AWS S3 Service

endpoint.description:
AWS Endpoint.
The endpoint URI to send requests to. The default endpoint is built from the configured region.

s3ForcePathStyle.description:
Whether to use path style URLs when communicating with S3.
Defaults to false.
This allows providers like LocalStack, Minio and Wasabi (and possibly others) to be used.

accessKeyId.description: Account access key used to authenticate requests.

secretAccessKey.description: Account secret key used to authenticate requests.

roleArn.description: ARN of the role to be assumed

externalId.description: External ID to use when assuming role

host.description: The hostname of the given Gitea instance

baseUrl.description: The base url for the Gitea instance.

username.description: The username to use for authenticated requests.

password.description:
Gitea password used to authenticate requests. This can be either a password
or a generated access token.

auth.description: Backend configuration for when request authentication is enabled

keys.description: Keys shared by all backends for signing and validating backend tokens.

secret.description:
Secret for generating tokens. Should be a base64 string, recommended
length is 24 bytes.

listen.description: Address that the backend should listen to.

host.description: Address of the interface that the backend should bind to.

port.description: Port that the backend should listen to.

https.description:
HTTPS configuration for the backend. If omitted the backend will serve HTTP.

Setting this to `true` will cause self-signed certificates to be generated, which
can be useful for local development or other non-production scenarios.

cert.description: PEM encoded certificate. Use $file to load in a file

key.description: PEM encoded certificate key. Use $file to load in a file.

database.description: Database connection configuration, select base database type using the `client` field

connection.description: Base database connection string, or object with individual connection properties

password.description: Password that belongs to the client User

ensureExists.description:
Whether to ensure the given database exists by creating it if it does not.
Defaults to true if unspecified.

pluginDivisionMode.description:
How plugins databases are managed/divided in the provided database instance.

`database` -> Plugins are each given their own database to manage their schemas/tables.

`schema` -> Plugins will be given their own schema (in the specified/default database)
            to manage their tables.

NOTE: Currently only supported by the `pg` client.

role.description: Configures the ownership of newly created schemas in pg databases.

knexConfig.description:
Arbitrary config object to pass to knex when initializing
(https://knexjs.org/#Installation-client). Most notable is the debug
and asyncStackTraces booleans

plugin.description: Plugin specific database configuration and client override

connection.description: Database connection string or Knex object override

ensureExists.description:
Whether to ensure the given database exists by creating it if it does not.
Defaults to base config if unspecified.

knexConfig.description:
Arbitrary config object to pass to knex when initializing
(https://knexjs.org/#Installation-client). Most notable is the
debug and asyncStackTraces booleans.

This is merged recursively into the base knexConfig

role.description: Configures the ownership of newly created schemas in pg databases.

cache.description: Cache connection configuration, select cache type using the `store` field

connection.description: A redis connection string in the form `redis://user:pass@host:port`.
A memcache connection string in the form `user:pass@host:port`.

reading.description:
Configuration related to URL reading, used for example for reading catalog info
files, scaffolder templates, and techdocs content.

allow.description:
A list of targets to allow outgoing requests to. Users will be able to make
requests on behalf of the backend to the targets that are allowed by this list.

host.description:
A host to allow outgoing requests to, being either a full host or
a subdomain wildcard pattern with a leading `*`. For example `example.com`
and `*.example.com` are valid values, `prod.*.example.com` is not.
The host may also contain a port, for example `example.com:8080`.

paths.description:
An optional list of paths. In case they are present only targets matching
any of them will are allowed. You can use trailing slashes to make sure only
subdirectories are allowed, for example `/mydir/` will allow targets with
paths like `/mydir/a` but will block paths like `/mydir2`.

csp.description:
Content Security Policy options.

The keys are the plain policy ID, e.g. "upgrade-insecure-requests". The
values are on the format that the helmet library expects them, as an
array of strings. There is also the special value false, which means to
remove the default value that Backstage puts in place for that policy.

endpoints.description:
Endpoints

A list of target baseUrls and the associated plugins.

target.description:
The target baseUrl to use for the plugin

Can be either a string or an object with internal and external keys.
Targets with `{{pluginId}}` or `{{ pluginId }} in the url will be replaced with the pluginId.

plugins.description: Array of plugins which use the target baseUrl.

permission.description: Configuration options for Backstage permissions and authorization

enabled.description:
Whether authorization is enabled in Backstage. Defaults to false, which means authorization
requests will be automatically allowed without invoking the authorization policy.

scaffolder.description: Configuration options for the scaffolder plugin

defaultAuthor.description: The commit author info used when new components are created.

defaultCommitMessage.description: The commit message used when new components are created.

concurrentTasksLimit.description:
Sets the number of concurrent tasks that can be run at any given time on the TaskWorker.

Defaults to 10.

Set to 0 to disable task workers altogether.

aws.description: Configuration for access to AWS accounts

accountDefaults.description: Defaults for retrieving AWS account credentials

roleName.description: The IAM role to assume to retrieve temporary AWS credentials

partition.description: The AWS partition of the IAM role, e.g. "aws", "aws-cn"

region.description: The STS regional endpoint to use when retrieving temporary AWS credentials, e.g. "ap-northeast-1"

externalId.description: The unique identifier needed to assume the role to retrieve temporary AWS credentials

mainAccount.description: Main account to use for retrieving AWS account credentials

accessKeyId.description: The access key ID for a set of static AWS credentials

secretAccessKey.description: The secret access key for a set of static AWS credentials

profile.description:
The configuration profile from a credentials file at ~/.aws/credentials and
a configuration file at ~/.aws/config.

region.description: The STS regional endpoint to use for the main account, e.g. "ap-northeast-1"

accounts.description: Configuration for retrieving AWS accounts credentials

accountId.description: The account ID of the target account that this matches on, e.g. "123456789012"

accessKeyId.description: The access key ID for a set of static AWS credentials

secretAccessKey.description: The secret access key for a set of static AWS credentials

profile.description:
The configuration profile from a credentials file at ~/.aws/credentials and
a configuration file at ~/.aws/config.

roleName.description: The IAM role to assume to retrieve temporary AWS credentials

partition.description: The AWS partition of the IAM role, e.g. "aws", "aws-cn"

region.description: The STS regional endpoint to use when retrieving temporary AWS credentials, e.g. "ap-northeast-1"

externalId.description: The unique identifier needed to assume the role to retrieve temporary AWS credentials

catalog.description: Configuration options for the catalog plugin.

rules.description:
Rules to apply to all catalog entities, from any location.

An undefined list of matchers means match all, an empty list of
matchers means match none.

This is commonly used to put in what amounts to an allowlist of kinds
that regular users of Backstage are permitted to register locations
for. This can be used to stop them from registering yaml files
describing for example a Group entity called "admin" that they make
themselves members of, or similar.

allow.description:
Allow entities of these particular kinds.

E.g. ["Component", "API", "Template", "Location"]

exact.description:
The exact location, e.g.
"https://github.com/org/repo/blob/master/users.yaml".

The exact location can also be used to match on locations
that contain glob characters themselves, e.g.
"https://github.com/org/*\/blob/master/*.yaml".

pattern.description:
The pattern allowed for the location, e.g.
"https://github.com/org/*\/blob/master/*.yaml".

readonly.description:
Readonly defines whether the catalog allows writes after startup.

Setting 'readonly=false' allows users to register their own components.
This is the default value.

Setting 'readonly=true' configures catalog to only allow reads. This can
be used in combination with static locations to only serve operator
provided locations. Effectively this removes the ability to register new
components to a running backstage instance.

locations.description:
A set of static locations that the catalog shall always keep itself
up-to-date with. This is commonly used for large, permanent integrations
that are defined by the Backstage operators at an organization, rather
than individual things that users register dynamically.

These have (optional) rules of their own. These override what the global
rules above specify. This way, you can prevent everybody from register
e.g. User and Group entities, except for one or a few static locations
that have those two kinds explicitly allowed.

For example:

```yaml
rules:
  - allow: [Component, API, Template, Location]
locations:
  - type: url
    target: https://github.com/org/repo/blob/master/users.yaml
    rules:
      - allow: [User, Group]
  - type: url
    target: https://github.com/org/repo/blob/master/systems.yaml
    rules:
      - allow: [System]
```

target.description:
The target URL of the location, e.g.
"https://github.com/org/repo/blob/master/users.yaml".

rules.description:
Optional extra rules that apply to this particular location.

These override the global rules above.

allow.description:
Allow entities of these particular kinds.

E.g. ["Group", "User"]

orphanStrategy.description:
The strategy to use for entities that are orphaned, i.e. no longer have
any other entities or providers referencing them. The default value is
"keep".

locationTemplate.description:
A templating string with placeholders, to form the final location of
the entity.

Defaults to '/catalog/:namespace/:kind/:name'

filter.description:
A filter expression passed to the catalog client, to select what
entities to collate.

Defaults to no filter, ie indexing all entities.

batchSize.description:
The number of entities to process at a time. Keep this at a
reasonable number to avoid overloading either the catalog or the
search backend.

Defaults to 500

schedule.description: The schedule for how often to run the collation job.
